title: Agbe
author: Agbe
created_time: May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMLast edit: May 22, 2022, 12:56:05 PM by Agbe
content: Bitcointalk is a community,  therefore it has structure, and rules guiding the users. So the quarterly analysis of Data is to know the areas of weakness and to know the areas of achievement which will help users to bring things out at the end of each quarter.There are four quarters in a year. Which are: 1. First quarter is from January to March.2. Second quarter is from April to June3. Third quarter is from July to September4. Forth quarter is from October to December.The purpose of this thread is to know the total record  achievements in the forum by quarterly. So by the end of the year it will be very easy to sum them up.  Therefore, what are the achievements of the first quarter of the year? FormatCode:Most Active Moderators............... username..................The mod that responses to threads, comments, other activities and always check up his or her board (s) everyday.Number of registered newbies..................Number of Plagiarised users..............with username..Number of tempban..........if you know any.......... username.......Number of permaban..........if you know any.......... username.........The most educative threads?...................The ones you learn something moreWho is corrective?......... username..........The users that are always correct you and encourage you. If possible links.Best local boards by Fillippone..........He is to mention themIs the forum policies are active?......... Yes or No............ Brief commentWhat do you think the forum has achieve and the weakness in the first quarter of the year that is not mentioned? Please first quarter is January to March. This has  already gone so I would like moderators to provide this.Example of the first quarterMost Active Moderators............... username..................Cyrus, hilariousandco etcNumber of registered newbies.................. Moderators should please drop data hereNumber of Plagiarised users..........7...Plagiarism analysis of Lovesmayfamilishttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5388389.msg59430082#msg59430082Thee. Number of tempban............and username............If you Know please drop hereNumber of permaban........159k...or...207,613. Banned history by LoyceV https://loyce.club/bans/banned.html , LoyceV banned usershttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5092983.0  number is not accurate as of first quarter of 2022, therefore, I am humbly pleading LoyceV and others modirators to give us the accurate data by quarterly.The most educative threads?................... username... with link.. ogNasty https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5289839.0 , so98nn https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5265782.0Who is corrective?......... username.......... Lovesmayfamilis and CryptopreneurBrainbossBest local boards by Fillippone.........Help me translate my best posts in your Local Boardhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5230761.0 from this thread he can select the most impressive translation from the local boardsIs the forum policies are active?......... Yes or No............ brief commentBitcointalk data base https://bpip.orgThis thread will be updating every quarter of the year.Second Quarter... loading

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: I think the forum is designed in a way to not have these (or to have them but in different places).Temp bans and perma bans for example can be found by going here: https://bitcointalk.org/modlog.phpA thread that's labelled as educative/interesting/unique might also support spam and is very subjective.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMCryptocurrencybrainboss [...] FullipponeI think that you renamed them, OP. You should change these names with "CryptopreneurBrainboss" and, respectively, "fillippone". Spelling people's name incorrectly may lead to have them not being notified by bots for being mentioned but, above all, may also make people feel insulted.Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMMost Active Moderators............... username..................DdmrDdmrDdmrDdmr is not a moderator, as far as I know...Last, but not least:How do you evaluate a mod's activity? By activity points...?And how do you evaluate who is corrective? Or most educative threads? Or best local board? What makes a local board to be the best?Don't take me wrong, but you need proper, objective and precise KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) defined for such evaluations...

comments.author: Agbe
comments.created_time: May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMLast edit: May 22, 2022, 12:30:43 PM by Agbe
comments.body: Thank you very much for pointing out the few corrections.Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMCryptocurrencybrainboss [...] FullipponeI think that you renamed them, OP. You should change these names with "CryptopreneurBrainboss" and, respectively, "fillippone". Spelling people's name incorrectly may lead to have them not being notified by bots for being mentioned but, above all, may also make people feel insulted.That has been corrected. But the bot you mentioned is not working by my end. I have been trying it for about one month to make sure I received alert but irony is the case. So I still prefer moderators and admin to create notification bar here in the forum.Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMDdmrDdmr is not a moderator, as far as I know...DoneQuote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMLast, but not least:How do you evaluate a mod's activity? By activity points...?The mods that response to threads, comments and always check up his or her board (s) everyday.Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMAnd how do you evaluate who is corrective?That should be personal point of view. The above names are from my point of view. Personally, I have seen Lovesmayfamilis in beginners & help. Correcting newbies in their threads and also encouraging newbies not to give up from the forum. And also CryptopreneurBrainboss has corrected a lot of newbies in the forum mostly in the local board and english boards. So I will want everyone to list theirs for the final sum up. The persons that make corrections and encourage newbies always. Please bring yours.Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PM Or most educative threads? The threads you learn something most and most exciting threads.Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMOr best local board? What makes a local board to be the best?This column is meant for Fillippone's threads. Help me translate my best posts in your Local Boardhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5230761.0 from this thread he can select the most impressive translation from the local boardsQuote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMDon't take me wrong, but you need proper, objective and precise KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) defined for such evaluations...Yes. But the OP is for all the users in the forum. If anyone has data he or she should provide it base on the format provided.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMThank you very much for pointing out the few corrections.Welcome! But there's more Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMBut the bot you mentioned is not working by my end. I have been trying it for about one month to make sure I received alert but IRONY is  the case. So I still prefer Moderators and admin create notification bar here in the forum.Better talk to bot's developer. Probably you're doing something wrong. Excepting that, no mod, nor the admin will create a notification bar for you.Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMQuote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMAnd how do you evaluate who is corrective?That should be PERSONAL point of view. [...]So I will want everyone to list thier for the final sum up. The persons that make corrections and encourage newbies always. Please bring yours.So there is no KPI involved, just subjectivity. OK, I understand now.Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMQuote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMOr most educative threads?The threads you learn something most and most exciting Threads.I believe that here you also imply just subjectivity and no KPI, right?Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMQuote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMOr best local board? What makes a local board to be the best?This column is meant for Fillippone's Threads. Help me translate my best posts in your Local Boardhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5230761.0 from this thread he can select the most impressive translation from the local boardsI am sorry, but I see absolutely no connection between the quality of translations made by some users for fillippone's topics and having a local board named "the best" based on that. For example, a local board may have a very low activity and yet, a user active in that board, to make a flawless translation for fillippone's topic(s). How would that make the respective board to be "the best"?And what made you choose those translations to be the criterion for having a board to be "the best"? I am sorry, I do not understand. Furthermore: have you ever asked fillippone if he would agree with such decision? I highly doubt that he would agree, as he would see also no connection between a good translation and naming a local board as "the best".And what does this "the best" actually mean? The best from what point of view? How do you define "the best"?OP, you should be a bit more rational or logic, if you like to do a statistic like this. You need clear criteria for your fields.Besides that, if you want to be taken seriously, you also need to spell the words correctly. Your topic and posts are full of typos and grammar errors (you use capital letters for some words, when it's not the case; you use double spaces sometimes between words; you spell wrong users' names; you spell wrong various words; you do not write dots (".") at the end of sentences; you use incorrectly the quote system etc.).These are some examples:1. Wrong use of quote system: in your reply to me you tried to quote me, but a part of my reply was quoted, while the other was not.2. Double space (between "is" and "the") and incorrect use to capital letter (for "Moderators" -- this term could be written with low caps "m"):Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMI have been trying it for about one month to make sure I received alert but IRONY is  the case. So I still prefer Moderators and admin 3. Incorrect use of capital letters ("Mods", "Thread" and "Board") + missing logic at the beginning of the sentence:Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMThe Mod's that is response to Threads, comments and always check up his or her Board (s) everyday.Probably, here you wanted to write "Mods' evaluation is based on they way they respond inside threads, on their comments and on their activity inside their boards".But the way you wrote the first part of the sentence makes no sense in English - "The Mod's that is response to Threads". What does that mean?4. Spelling error:Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMSo I will want everyone to list thier for the final sum upThe word is "their", not "thier"Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMNumber of pamban..........if you know any.......... username.........Perhaps you wanted to write "permaban"?Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMNumber of temban..........if you know any.......... username.......Perhaps you wanted to write "tempban"?Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMNumber of Plagiarised users..............with username..Perhaps you wanted to write "plagiarist users"?Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMIs the forum policies are active?......... Yes or No............ Brief commentWhat does "Is the forum policies are active?" mean in English? This sentence makes no sense.Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMI would like modirators to provide this.Modirators...?Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMThe most educative Threads?................... username... with link.. ogNastyHis username is OgNasty, not ogNasty...Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMSecond Quarter.... loadingHere you used four dots, instead of three. The punctuation symbol "..." has only three dots.Look, OP: again, don't take me wrong. But when you write a topic or a post, you should also re-read it prior submitting the post. Check your writing for proofreading; correct the typos; correct the various errors you may encounter. Never write a bunch of words and then immediately click on "Post", without checking first what you just wrote.And when you are using the "Preview" function, you can see that the text editor underlines (with a red line) the words which are spelled incorrectly. Correct those ones, at least. Or use another text editor, with dictionary set to English.Writing the way you do looks just like a mess, no matter if you even have a good idea. And, if you want to have the chance to be taken seriously or into consideration, you should present, at least, a correct text. If you'd read a book full of spelling errors, what would you think / do? Wouldn't you say "Who is the underclassman which wrote this junk?", then throw it away? What I want to say is that, if you write like that there are high chances that users will also not even read your posts. Who would lose time for reading some gibberish?I understand that you may not be an English native (if you are, the situation is even worst, as you are supposed to know your own language); many users from here are not English natives as well. But they make efforts to have correct writings. At least to use the text editor from "Preview" function... You may never have a text typo-free. But, at least, if you have just a few and minor ones, you can show that you tried, at least, to write a good and correct text.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 21, 2022, 07:27:23 PMHow do you evaluate a mod's activity? By activity points...?And how do you evaluate who is corrective? Or most educative threads? Or best local board? What makes a local board to be the best?Don't take me wrong, but you need proper, objective and precise KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) defined for such evaluations...There's actually no way in SMF to view which moderator deleted a particular topic, but the record of deleted posts is available in the modlog. It's mixed with bans though, so maybe you need to cross-reference with some auxillary tool that separates them (does LoyceV have a tool for that?)

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 22, 2022, 08:23:56 AMOP, you should be a bit more rational or logic, if you like to do a statistic like this. You need clear criteria for your fields.I don't understand what OP is trying to do here at all.  This thread is just bizarre and confusing.  Take this for example:Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMSo the quarterly analysis of Data is to know the areas of weakness and to know the areas of achievement which will help users to bring things out at the end of each quarter.The part in bold just does not compute.  There's never been a need for anything OP is suggesting, and it's perplexing to me as to why a relative newcomer would propose all of this crap.  Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMThere are four quarters in a year. Which are: Whew.  If you hadn't written them out, I would have had no idea which months were in each 12-month calendar year.  OP, just stop with this merit phishing.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on May 22, 2022, 09:46:44 AMQuote from: GazetaBitcoin on May 22, 2022, 08:23:56 AMOP, you should be a bit more rational or logic, if you like to do a statistic like this. You need clear criteria for your fields.I don't understand what OP is trying to do here at all.  This thread is just bizarre and confusing.  Take this for example:Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 01:21:37 PMSo the quarterly analysis of Data is to know the areas of weakness and to know the areas of achievement which will help users to bring things out at the end of each quarter.The part in bold just does not compute.  There's never been a need for anything OP is suggesting, and it's perplexing to me as to why a relative newcomer would propose all of this crap. Lolz.. you know quite well everyone is looking for avenue to make something exceptional from others. So op tried to put something different from the community, without organizing them in order. From the beginning of op composition to the end is confusing and annoying. So let us bear with op and say it's part of learning....lol.Quote from: The Pharmacist on May 22, 2022, 09:46:44 AMWhew.  If you hadn't written them out, I would have had no idea which months were in each 12-month calendar year.  OP, just stop with this merit phishing.When you divide one (1) year into two, is six (6) months, while per annual is twelve (12) months.. then op continue to split the months per quarter in order to have ambiguous thread.. from my perspective it's improper. It's better to create a short thread with proper understanding and nice view, than creating a thread that's not supportive.

Third quarter is from July to September4. Forth quarter is from October to December.I'm going to be sarcastic: Thanks for explaining pre-school again!QuoteNumber of temban............and username............If you Know please drop hereThis data isn't public.QuoteNumber of pamban........159k...or...207,613. Banned history by LoyceV https://loyce.club/bans/banned.htmlPlease don't quote data from 2020 without checking the actual data, which shows 303,614 bans.QuoteLoyceV banned usersI did not do such a thing!Quotehttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5092983.0  number is not accurate as of first quarter of 2022, therefore, I am humbly pleading LoyceV and others modirators to give us the accurate data by quarterly.I'm not a "modirator". Why do you call banned users an achivement anyway?Quote from: The Pharmacist on May 22, 2022, 09:46:44 AMI don't understand what OP is trying to do here at all.I'll take a guess: he needs 8 Merit to become Full Member.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on May 22, 2022, 11:10:15 AMQuoteLoyceV banned usersI did not do such a thing!Marcel, do not hide the truth! We all know you are a cruel man! At last, someone had guts and exposed you!Quote from: LoyceV on May 22, 2022, 11:10:15 AMI'm not a "modirator"Quote from: LoyceV on May 22, 2022, 11:10:15 AMQuote from: The Pharmacist on May 22, 2022, 09:46:44 AMI don't understand what OP is trying to do here at all.I'll take a guess: he needs 8 Merit to become Full Member.Lol, now it figures... Somehow I missed this detail. Probably he needed to make further explanations, about how each month is divided in weeks, how weeks are divided in days, how days are divided in hours (and so on), in order to obtain the 8 merits. But like that, explaining just how the year is divided in quarters, it's not 8-merits-worthy at all.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: I think we're fine with the public voting in the yearly awards, while they aren't entirely accurate they do bring something to the community, and also motivate users to get better. No need for quarterly achievements. I guess if you want to see the best threads or what not you can check the merit statistics which show the most recent highly merited threads, and also replies. That's probably the only way we could measure it, and even then that's subjective. Quote from: Agbe on May 21, 2022, 08:30:49 PMThe mods that response to threads, comments and always check up his or her board (s) everyday.This isn't a very good indicator of moderators that are active in terms of how much work they're doing behind the scenes. Honestly, some of the moderators aren't very active in posting, but they're kicking arse behind the scenes. So, these recognitions, and awards are always rather biased to those that are posting regularly in the public eye. The reality is most moderators are doing a ton of work, and only theymos really knows the numbers behind it. Quote from: LoyceV on May 22, 2022, 11:10:15 AMQuoteLoyceV banned usersI did not do such a thing!We're onto you now  .

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: I am very sorry for creating this thread. I was trying to divide the forum achievements by quarterly for easy understanding from the following format. Most active moderators............... username..................The mod that responses to threads, comments, other activities and always check up his or her board (s) everyday.Number of registered newbies..................Number of plagiarised users..............with username..Number of tempban..........if you know any.......... username.......Number of permaban..........if you know any.......... username.........The most educative threads?...................The ones you learn something moreWho is corrective?......... username..........The users that are always correct you and encourage you. If possible links.Best local boards by Fillippone..........He is to mention themIs the forum policies are active?......... Yes or No............ Brief commentAnd I was expecting you to correct, direct and guide me to get the information but Irony is the case. Since the thread is rubish, I will want the moderator to delete it. A poem written by T.S. Eliot"The Waste Land"https://www.poetryfoundation.org/poems/47311/the-waste-landEven "The Waste Land" nothing is wasted. People learned things from itI brought this thread for public opinion for data collection for quarterly publication of information and to know how many users were banned, the total number of registered newbies in each quarter, and other things but the thread is seen to be caricature. Some accused me of hunting merit with the thread. But I want to thank God that upon all the rubish, there is sense in it.
